data.title: Small but great!
data.text: Everything I have seen at Theater Works has been enjoyable. I just attended the Gershwin show which was excellent. Great music and dancing. Both theaters are small and the talent is mostly local but I've never seen a bad show. And all of the seats are good.

data.title: Excellent Production
data.text: We went to see an Excellent Production of  Noises Off   The Cast was very-very-GOOD!! Very funny and entertaining!!   We have been to Theater Works for several shows   and we will be back for more

data.title: Best little theater in Peoria
data.text: I have attended many plays, musicals and kids performances at this theater.  I have NEVER been disappointed with any of the shows.  The attendants are very personable and always there to help you.  I recommend this theater to all of my friends and family and I personally attend almost every show they put on.

data.title: Good show and good food.
data.text: You can see pretty good in most of the seating. Avoid outer edge seats. Better food that I expected and actually hoe when it was served. The service was  also  friendly and good.

data.title: Man of La Mancha
data.text: We went with friends to see Don Quixote and could not have been more satisfied!  We were there for opening night and this theatre house goes all out on said night.  They catered succulent steak sandwiches from Flemings and fantastic cupcakes, all washed down with complimentary wine!  The cast was fantastic and the theatre is so quaint there isn't a bad seat to be had!  Will DEFINITELY be back!

data.title: Very nice for family entertainment
data.text: Family can enjoy a nice evening out attending shows here. Locals provide a lot of support. Nice atmosphere. Not too much parking directly outside of the theatre. You can park at nearby streets.

data.title: Wonderful and intimate
data.text:
We have selectively attended many plays over the years.  All have been excellent.  Most recently we attended both "How to Succeed in Business without realy trying", and a Eastern Europe chamber muxic concert.
All were excellent.  The play funny with a great cast.  The music very professional.

data.title: Delightful entertainment!
data.text: This was our first visit to this theater and we were DAZZLED with the performance. We saw "I Get a Kick Out of Cole", the story of songwriter Cole Porter, intertwined with loads of his songs done with a great sense of style. They have a small concession stand, and I was shocked that water was only $2, since it is usually price gouged at other venues my husband and I have been to. It was a comparatively intimate theater, and we were pretty close, but I think any seats would be good ones. There was also a smaller children's theater showing simultaneously. You will thoroughly enjoy a visit to see any show here, and we will definitely be returning for more great entertainment. Lots of handicap seating too and free parking right accross the way!!!

data.title: evening at theater
data.text: the theater is a very modern building that lacks a dedicated parking lot.  seats are comfy and the show was good.  actors were giving good performances and sets were ok.  location on Grand Ave at Peoria Ave in Old Town of Peoria is easy to get to.

data.title: Outstanding performances
data.text: This small theater expanded its horizons with the fantastic production of Ragtime! A must-see show. support local theater!

data.title: Community Theater, Professional Quality
data.text: We just saw "Big" playing at Theater Works.  It's on it's last weekend of the 3 week run.  This is an awesome theater experience for the ticket price.  The young actors from the youth program were exceptional and the older actors, some are with Actors' Equity, also do an outstanding job.  This was rated as one of the top 3 events in September by the Arizona Republic.  If you miss this show, you should check out some of the ones coming soon. We can't wait to see some of the other shows queued up for the season, including Ragtime, A Christmas Carol, and Mama Won't Fly for the older crowd. There's also several puppet theater performances for the younger ones. The location is the Peoria Center for the Performing Arts, which is a smaller theater and provides a more intimate closeness with the stage and actors.

data.title: Great for Couples
data.text: My wife & I attended a show and a movie here.  We saw Tarzan, and thought that the actors were great. The food was good also, small portions but prepared the way we wanted.
